page.title: 15LEISURE IN BERKHAMSTED.
page.content: Children in Berkhamsted take part in a wide variey of activities. The most popular pastimes are watching television, reading, playing on bicycles or playing football. The youngee children, aged up to 9 and 10 attend a number of clubs, including swimming, cubs, brownies, Sunday School, gymnastics and drama club, these being run by volunteers. The older children, 9-16 years, have a more limited range of activities available to them. Very few attend Scouts or Guides and there is not a youth club in this town of almost 20 000 people. Adults indulge in reading, gardening, walking and jogging. Golf, squash, bowling, keep fit and badminton facilities are available. Choirs, an art group and a drama group are also available.We have a three screen cinema and a summer use only swimming pool.
